info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert County through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Elberton, or near Nancy Hart State Park, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Fortsonia and Rice Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
